statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Iona 88, Richmond 79
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Mike Glover scored 24 points and hot-shooting Iona cruised past Richmond 88-79 on Wednesday night. Glover made 11 of 13 field goal attempts as the Gaels (8-2) shot 58.7 percent (37 of 63), their second-best shooting effort this season. Iona entered the game second in the nation in scoring average (87.4). Sean Armand added 17 points, and Lamont Jones and Ra'Shad James had 14 each for the Gaels. Iona's Scott Machado finished with 13 points and 15 assists. Iona trailed 42-41 early in the second half, then used a 10-0 burst to take a 51-42 lead with 14:11 to play. A 9-0 run a few minutes later gave the Gaels their biggest lead at 74-56 with 6:12 to play. Cedric Lindsay scored 21 points, Kendall Anthony added 18 and Darrius Garrett posted his first career double-double with 13 points and 11 rebounds for Richmond (6-4), which has lost two straight.
